conclusion: Points A, B, and C are liquid release points; Points D and E are collection containers; colored bars/baffles affect liquid flow; liquid flows downward due to gravity.
Purple baffle is diagonal on the right side.
Purple baffle will deflect liquid flowing from above it toward the right.
Brown baffle is diagonal on the upper left.
Brown baffle will deflect liquid toward the bottom-left.
Yellow baffle is diagonal on the left side.
Yellow baffle will deflect liquid toward the bottom-right.
Gray baffle is diagonal on the right side.
Gray baffle will deflect liquid toward the bottom-left.
Green and orange structures at the bottom are the collection containers D and E.
Liquid drops straight down from point A (turquoise block on left side).
Liquid from point A will hit the purple baffle and be deflected toward the right.
After deflection, liquid from point A will continue downward toward container E (green).
Liquid drops straight down from point B (yellow block).
Liquid from point B will hit the purple baffle and be deflected toward the right.
After deflection, liquid from point B will continue downward toward container E (green).
Liquid drops straight down from point C (blue block on right side).
Liquid from point C doesn't hit the purple baffle (falls to the right of it).
Liquid from point C will hit the gray baffle and be deflected toward the left.
After deflection, liquid from point C will flow toward container E (green).
All three paths (A, B, and C) end up being directed toward container E (the green one).
None of the flows appear to be directed toward container D (the orange one).
Liquid from points A, B, and C will all flow into container E.
